definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: Crosswalks even got a fresh coat of paint to encourage walking and biking.
sentences.chinese: 過街天橋上都掛上鼓勵步行和騎車的條幅。

sentences.english: An overpass is being put up at the corner of the street.
sentences.chinese: 在那條街的拐角處正在建起一個過街天橋。

sentences.english: You may cross the street by the footbridge.
sentences.chinese: 你可以走過街天橋過馬路。

sentences.english: After you do, ahead of you, you'll see two pedestrian fly overs.
sentences.chinese: 之後在你的前方你會看到兩座過街天橋。

sentences.english: Just down under the overline bridge.
When we need to cross the street, we should always use the pedestrian crossings or pedestrian bridges.
sentences.chinese: 過馬路時，我們一定要走人行橫道或過街天橋。

sentences.english: More and more highways and overhead walkways have been built up.
sentences.chinese: 北京已建成越來越多的高速公路和過街天橋。

sentences.english: A path marked off for pedestrians crossing a street.
sentences.chinese: 過馬路時，我們一定要走人行橫道或過街天橋。

sentences.english: Crosswalks een got a fresh coat of paint to encourage walking and biking.
sentences.chinese: 過街天橋上都掛上鼓勵步行和騎車的條幅。

sentences.english: The city built a pedestrian overpass over the highway.
sentences.chinese: 城裏在公路上建了一座過街天橋。

sentences.english: Turn to the right, you can see a pedestrian overpass at the intersection.
sentences.chinese: 向右轉，你可以看到在十字路口有一座行人過街天橋。

sentences.english: When one crosses the street, one should take the crosswalk, underground passage or pedestrian overpass.
sentences.chinese: 當你穿過馬路，要走人行橫道或過街天橋，地下通道。

sentences.english: Another fly-over will be built across the street.
sentences.chinese: 這條街上將要建另外一座過街天橋。

sentences.english: Chen Hao has no alternative come to overpass sing for a living, make chummage and living cost.
sentences.chinese: 陳浩萬般無奈來到過街天橋賣唱，掙房租和生活費。
